lines.text: Trumpets sound. Enter MARK ANTONY and EROS a Soldier meeting them

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: The gods make this a happy day to Antony!

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Would thou and those thy scars had once prevaild To make me fight at land!

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: Hadst thou done so, The kings that have revolted, and the soldier That has this morning left thee, would have still Followd thy heels.

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: Who! One ever near thee: call for Enobarbus, He shall not hear thee or from Caesars camp Say I am none of thine.

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: Sir, his chests and treasure He has not with him.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Go, Eros, send his treasure after do it Detain no jot, I charge thee: write to him I will subscribegentle adieus and greetings Say that I wish he never find more cause To change a master. O, my fortunes have Corrupted honest men! Dispatch.Enobarbus!
